My statement on the Senate's bipartisan health care proposal that was released today:  "Arizona families live in fear that their health care premiums could skyrocket or that they could lose their access to coverage any day. For too long, Washington has played political football with their health and wellbeing, and it must stop.   "I am pleased to see the Senate's health care proposal includes many of the key components of the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus's health care plan, which was unveiled in July. As a member of the Caucus, I have worked with my colleagues on sensible solutions. This is a good start to fixing our health care system and bringing stability to our families, seniors, and veterans.  "I have called for bipartisan health care solutions throughout the year, and I commend all who have put aside political dogma in favor of compromise and thoughtful policymaking that includes many policies for which I have advocated."

45 years ago today, Congress passed the bipartisan Clean Water Act. This law has protected surface-water quality in Arizona, prevented water pollution, and has provided critical resources for programs that control erosion and improve watersheds like the Whitlock Valley watershed near Safford. It serves as a symbol for what we can accomplish when we work together, regardless of political party.  As a public servant I have dedicated much of my work to water conservation in Arizona. As a member of the House Agriculture Committee, I am committed to continuing that work in Congress and passing legislation that promotes a sustainable water future for generations of Arizonans.
